channel.title: How to cheat in a school exam
channel.description:
Before you read : I learnt this from watching a youtube video.
Items needed; Glue A scanner & Printer Your favourite drink bottle with drink inside A text/image editor Glossy Paper
Ok, first off remove the label from your drink bottle, scan it your computer. Once its scanned open it ina text/image editor. Replace the calories of the drink ect with something that will help you beat the exam. Then print it off, use glossy paper so it doesnt look much different. Then using glue, stick it back on your bottle.
Credits 90% Phonescooper - Youtube 10% Me
also posted here [url=http://haxzordivision.freeforums.org/how-to-cheat-in-a-school-exam-t7.html]http://haxzordivision.freeforums.org/how-to-cheat-in-a-school-exam-t7.html[/url]

item.title: How to cheat in a school exam
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

davidude36:

In our exams, and, well all of the GCSE exams you are not allowed to have a bottle with a label on it, and it must be clear liquid inside.

I got told to take mine off in the middle of a 2 hour English exam. Made so much noise I had the whole year staring at me, lol.

Off-topic (sorry) - how are your exams going? Nearly all finished

Read full topic

item.title: How to cheat in a school exam
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Like Dan, I have one of those fancy calculators too. Some people ask me if it gets internet, being it’s so big >_>

Anyways, I usually store equations and such in it, which is really helpful at times. That’s good for tests and all, but on the big exams, they always supply the tiny calculators with all the basic functions, nothing special.

Read full topic
